definition:
A *generalized Vandermonde matrix* is a square matrix with entries in
$\mathbb{R}$ of the form:

$$(a_i^{b_j})_{i,j=1}^n = \begin{pmatrix}
a_1^{b_1} & a_1^{b_2} & \cdots & a_1^{b_n} \cr
a_2^{b_1} & a_2^{b_2} & \cdots & a_2^{b_n} \cr
\vdots & \vdots & & \vdots \cr
a_n^{b_1} & a_n^{b_2} & \cdots & a_n^{b_n}
\end{pmatrix}$$ with real numbers $ 0<a_1<a_2<\cdots<a_n$ and
$ b_1<b_2<\cdots<b_n$.
